question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000?
true_answer: Based on your income and assuming typical debt obligations, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent to evaluate loan affordability. 2) Use calculator to assess DTI. 3) Verify with credit_agent if needed. 4) Final review by supervisor_agent. 5) Provide answer.
Retrieving knowledge on home loan affordability calculation.
Affordability is typically calculated as 4 times the annual income, adjusted for debts.
Calculating maximum loan based on $80,000 income.
Initial calculation suggests a maximum loan of $320,000 before considering debts.
What if I have other debts?
Retrieving knowledge on impact of existing debts on loan affordability.
Existing debts will lower the maximum loan amount. DTI ratio should be maintained below 43%.
Recalculating with assumed debts of $10,000 annually.
Adjusted maximum loan amount is approximately $300,000.
Based on your income and assuming typical debt obligations, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000.
Note: Ensure credit score is also factored in for loan approval.
